If a new function \\( y(t) = e^{-Ct} \\) (where C is another constant matrix) is applied as an intervention after computing \\( \\mathcal{F}[h(t)] \\), will the new resultant function depend only on A and not C?
Explanation: The intervention with the new function \\( y(t) = e^{-Ct} \\) adds complexity based on the new matrix C, integrating into the existing transformed state brought about by A. The outcome would depend on both matrices A and C, potentially altering the behavior and final output of the system.
